alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 11:39PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Montgomery County through 1230 AM CDT... At 1139 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montgomery, or 11 miles southwest of Willis, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Conroe, Panorama Village, Montgomery and Lake Conroe Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Conroe, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
